content:
advertisement

The headline on yesterdays Collegian read  A powerful statement confirming that President George Bush had given the go ahead on what we now know as Operation Desert Storm PERIOD

A panel discussion on the military draft planned several months ago was scheduled to start at  last night PERIOD Students faculty staff and community members had an opportunity to discuss their views on the possible effects of the draft on University students  should a draft be initiated PERIOD

We know now that student and staff reservists have been called to serve PERIOD The possibility of a draft has been on the minds of some students PERIOD The Persian Gulf is on the minds of virtually all of us PERIOD

It seems fortuitous and appropriate that opportunities like the panel discussion sponsored by student counselors of the Campus Life Assistance Center be made available PERIOD Open dialogue and expression of different perspectives is the nature of a university PERIOD

There is no singular position which can be expressed about the events of this hour where Penn State sons and daughters relatives and friends half a world way are engaged in military conflict PERIOD

Student Services staff and student volunteers will be available for individual and group discussions of the extremely complex issues raised by the Persian Gulf crisis PERIOD

Penn State as an open and caring community must be a place where civility and the wellbeing of each member is of primary concern PERIOD The Campus Life Assistance Center is available to help at  PERIOD Pray the conflict ends soon and a peaceful solution to the Persian situation is found PERIOD

William Asbury

vice president for student services
